intro: Melanthera aspera, commonly known as rough beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, square stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, rough hairs, contributing to its common name. Melanthera aspera is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
